documents.review_text: once i get past the first mission it QUITS like me with my first job. i cant even play on sand-box mode. please help!!!!!

These are among the most nicely detailed amiibo I've seen so far.  Great use of multiple materials, that parts that should shine do and the parts that shouldn't don't.  I suspect that because the design of the characters is so simple they were more able to flesh out the details.

I have had this game for a few hours now, and I can already feel myself getting better. It comes with the guitar, two picks, a strap, a USB cord, and a regular guitar cord (for plugging into an amp). It's very easy to set up. You take it out, plug it in, and you're good to go. It takes you through a brief tutorial on how to play, and then tunes the strings, telling you how to do it. Before every song, it has you retune your guitar for that song, or makes sure your guitar is still in tune. Then you play. At first glance, it is very intimidating, especially if you're used to playing Rock Band or Guitar Hero. Stick with it, though. It gets easier as you go. As you get better, it introduces new techniques, and offers a "challenge" to better teach you how to play using those techniques. I am a beginner guitar player. I played a number of years ago, and didn't take formal lessons. I jumped right in and felt at home. You have two options; you can play your "journey," where you practice a few songs, get a high enough score to qualify, then go perform them to move on. Your other option is to just jump into whatever song you wish. I found myself doing both. The bottom line is, if you were having second thoughts about buying this game, just go for it. If you want to learn how to play, you will. It really is wonderful. Yes, the guitar is a "cheaper" version, but if you're just starting to learn, you don't need anything better. And the good thing is, once you get better, you can buy a better guitar and use it for this game because it works with ANY GUITAR. It honestly is wonderful. You won't regret this purchase.

I almost bought an Xbox 360 just to play Ninja Gaiden 2.  Luckily, if you only have a PS3 you can have this not-so-new, but improved game. I'm a huge fan of the series and this one bears the Ninja Gaiden name proudly. You can get an overview of the game in better places then my review, so I'll just get to the point:   - Game looks and plays fantastic. No slowdown, which 360 owners were reporting, but just a minor occurence of screen-tearing, barely noticeable and does not affect the experience.  - Difficulty. This is no easy game, but it's by far the easiest Ninja Gaiden I ever played. Veterans will find their challenge in difficulty settings that will get unlocked after you play through the game the first time. Newcomers to the series will enjoy the action without smashing their controllers when playing on Alcolyte and Warrior modes offered from the beginning. I think it was a smart decision on part of developers.  - Blood and Gore. Many people have complained about the removal of over-the-top blood and gore that Ninja Gaiden 2 on Xbox was famous for. I'd say the level of depiction of violence in Sigma 2 is on par with Sigma 1 - some blood, but nothing like the Xbox version. What I don't understand is why this game is still rated M.  - New Characters. These are actually fun to play with, not just thrown in for the sake of putting them on the game cover.  In short, I recommend this to anyone who likes action games. Previous Ninja Gaiden games were not for everyone due to their crushing difficulty. The only exception to my recommendation: if you already played Ninja Gaiden 2 on Xbox, you may not find that this game is worth the full price. If not - get it, it's one of the best games this year.

documents.product_title: Adventure Workshop Preschool-1st Grade 8th Edition [Old Version]
documents.review_text: I'm a computer teacher, teaching children ages 2-5 and they love all these games. Another reviewer said that her children didn't know how to play the games, but we as teachers (or parents) are supposed to help them learn. For all my age groups we do lessons on the arrow keys several times in the year and the Authur game is great for reinforcing the lesson. This is a great group of programs.

dimensions.name: Reliability
dimensions.description: The review is considered reliable, as opposed to reporting unreliable information

mapping.label: Completely Disagree:
mapping.description: the review provides unreliable or untrustworthy information

mapping.label: Partially Disagree:
mapping.description: the review has some unreliable information

mapping.label: Neutral:
mapping.description: the review's reliability cannot be definitively determined

mapping.label: Partially Agree:
mapping.description: the review is mostly reliable

mapping.label: Completely Agree:
mapping.description: the review is entirely reliable and considered trustworthy

dimensions.name: Neutrality
dimensions.description: The review is expressed in objective terms, as opposed to resulting subjective or biased

mapping.label: Completely Disagree:
mapping.description: the review is highly subjective or biased, providing unreliable information

mapping.label: Partially Disagree:
mapping.description: the review has some elements of neutrality but also contains subjective or biased expressions

mapping.label: Neutral:
mapping.description: the neutrality of the review cannot be definitively determined

mapping.label: Partially Agree:
mapping.description: the review is mostly expressed in objective terms but may have some subjective elements

mapping.label: Completely Agree:
mapping.description: the review is entirely neutral, expressed objectively without bias

dimensions.name: Precision
dimensions.description: The review is precise/specific, as opposed to vague

mapping.label: Completely Disagree:
mapping.description: the review provides imprecise and vague information

mapping.label: Partially Disagree:
mapping.description: the review contains some imprecise details and vagueness

mapping.label: Neutral:
mapping.description: the review's precision cannot be definitively determined

mapping.label: Partially Agree:
mapping.description: the review is mostly precise, with some specific details

mapping.label: Completely Agree:
mapping.description: the review is entirely precise and considered trustworthy

dimensions.name: Completeness
dimensions.description: The review is complete as opposed to partial

mapping.label: Completely Disagree:
mapping.description: the review is deficient in crucial details, presenting an incomplete overview

mapping.label: Partially Disagree:
mapping.description: the review includes some details, but overall, it is incomplete

mapping.label: Neutral:
mapping.description: the completeness of the review cannot be definitively determined

mapping.label: Partially Agree:
mapping.description: the review is mostly complete in providing necessary details

mapping.label: Completely Agree:
mapping.description: the review provides a comprehensive overview

dimensions.name: Informativeness
dimensions.description: The review allows deriving useful information as opposed to well-known facts and/or tautologies

mapping.label: Completely Disagree:
mapping.description: the review lacks informative content, providing insufficient details

mapping.label: Partially Disagree:
mapping.description: the review has some informative elements, but overall, it is not fully detailed

mapping.label: Neutral:
mapping.description: the informativeness of the review cannot be definitively determined

mapping.label: Partially Agree:
mapping.description: the review is mostly informative, offering relevant details

mapping.label: Completely Agree:
mapping.description: the review is entirely informative, delivering a comprehensive and detailed analysis

dimensions.name: Confidence
dimensions.description: How confident do you feel about the answers you provided? Please select a corresponding number
dimensions.example: 0 means completely not confident and 100 means sure

justification.text: Write at least 10 words justifying the entered value.
